intro: Cadetia cuneilabia, commonly known as the narrow-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Cadetia cuneilabia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
